custgwttbl.client
Class CustGwtItemBean

java.lang.Object
  custgwttbl.client.CustGwtItemBean

public class CustGwtItemBean
extends java.lang.Object

This is the item bean which holds the information of item. If it used in a grid then items for each cell of a particular column depends on the bean assigned to it. When grid gets created it takes the information from the bean.

          Creates an empty bean object

Method Detail

getExtraHight

public int getExtraHight()
Returns the extra height set for the editable component

Returns:
extra height

setExtraHight

public void setExtraHight(int newExtraHight)
This is the extra height which will be added or reduced while puting the editing component. This is useful to make UI stable while setting the editable component. Default is -2.If you are using CSS no need to set this.

Parameters:
newExtraHight - extra height

isTextAsTitle

public boolean isTextAsTitle()
Retruns whether text will be set as title

Returns:
true if text is set as title(tool tip text) too

setTextAsTitle

public void setTextAsTitle(boolean newTextAsTitle)
Sets whether the text will be shown as title(tool tip text). It is valid for only NON_EDITABLE and EDITABLE item. If your non editable component text is large, then you can set word wrap true for that component. But word wrapping may distort the grid UI. So either you can increase the height of the row or you can keep wrod wrap false and set setTextAsTitle as true, so in that case user can see the large inner text as tool tip for that component.

Parameters:
newTextAsTitle - true or false

getTitleText

public java.lang.String getTitleText()
Returns the tool tip text for the item

Returns:
title text

setTitleText

public void setTitleText(java.lang.String newTitleText)
Sets the tool tip text for the item.If you set it, this will be shown as toll tip for all components of that row for a grid

Parameters:
newTitleText - tool tip for item

getTextAlign

public HasHorizontalAlignment.HorizontalAlignmentConstant getTextAlign()
Gets the horizontal alignment of the text

Returns:
alignment of the inner text

setTextAlign

public void setTextAlign(HasHorizontalAlignment.HorizontalAlignmentConstant newTextAlign)
Sets the horizontal alignment of the text of the item. This is valid for NON_EDITABLE and NON_EDITABLE_HTML.If you set it in CSS , then setting it will effect the whole column for a grid.

Parameters:
newTextAlign - horizontal alignment of the item

hasImage

public boolean hasImage()
Returns whether item has a image in it

Returns:
true if it has an image

setHasImage

public void setHasImage(boolean bImage)
Sets true if item has image. If it is true it will cosider the text as an image url and try to fetch that image and show as an item content.

Parameters:
bImage - true if item has image

Sets the column width. You can set it is % or in pixel. e.g 12% or 20px

Parameters:
newColumnWidth - coulm width

hasHTML

public boolean hasHTML()
Returns true if content of the item is html

Returns:
true if item content is html

setHTML

public void setHTML(boolean bHtml)
Sets whether content of the item should be considered as html or not. If it is true, item content will be put as html. It is useful for showing hyperlink as item content.

Parameters:
bHtml - true if content to be considered as html

setWordWrap

public void setWordWrap(boolean newWrap)
Sets whether content of item should be wrapped or not. This is valid for NON_EDITABLE and NON_EDITABLE_HTML item content.

Parameters:
newWrap - true if item content to be wrapped

getWordWrap

public boolean getWordWrap()
Returns true if item content to be wrapped.

Returns:
true if item content to be wrapped

setItemHeight

public void setItemHeight(int newHeight)
Sets the item height. If You set height in CSS already , then Setting this will effect only for all the cells in the particular column for a grid.

Parameters:
newHeight - height of the item.

Parameters:
newLength - item length

getDBValue

public java.lang.String getDBValue(java.lang.String displayValue)
Return the DB value which was cached earlier by setValuesTable(HashMap newValuesTable). If no db value found , it will return the display value

Parameters:
displayValue - is the key to be searched in the cache
Returns:
db value against that display value.
